word.literal: in the blink of an eye

sentence.idiomatic: Time really passes quickly--before I knew it, three years had passed by.

word.literal: in the blink of an eye

sentence.idiomatic: How did he disappear in an instant?

word.literal: in the blink of an eye

sentence.idiomatic: Before I knew it, the children were all grown up.
What plans do you have for after you graduate?
She got married as soon as she graduated.
I graduated from Beijing University.
You really don't have any prospects.
This child is really clever. When he grows up he will definitely have a bright future.
This man doesn't have any prospects at all--he can't even find a job.
It wasn't easy for him to find a job with a high salary.
It wasn't easy for you to come here for a trip, you must stay a few days longer.
It wasn't easy for me to get through to his home phone.
He doesn't have any kind of skills--he only knows how to have a good time.
So long as you have ability, no one will dare to look down on you.
His bragging skills are great.
He's that ugly and wants to be a movie star? I think there's no hope.
We're competing against such a strong team. There's definitely no hope of us winning.
You haven't bought a ring? Then proposing to her is definitely hopeless.
His diploma is fake.
When big companies are hiring, in general they all pay quite a bit of attention to one's diploma.
To apply for this position you need an undergraduate diploma.
He is about to graduate. Recently he has been doing an internship.
Which companies have you interned at?
When he interned at the hospital, his performance was outstanding.
You really have good taste. This is the newest style for this spring--it's been very popular.
Her expectations are very high. She isn't satisfied with ordinary guys.
Graduates nowadays have a common flaw--their expectations are too high, and their skill-levels too low.
Uncle, you came!

word.literal: in the blink of an eye

sentence.idiomatic: Yep! You graduated before I knew it. Your future is bright!
Oh, it wasn't easy to graduate. When I was studying I wanted to work. Now that I've graduated, I don't want to.
Yeah, a student's life is the happiest. But working is good too! You learned so many things, so it's time to use them.
Nowadays there are too many people with an education. Graduates from top universities can't even find jobs. Someone like me, a graduate of an average university, has even less hope.
Young people should have confidence. I'm telling you, what we're talking about here is work ability, not a diploma. How was the company you interned at? Do you want to keep doing it?
I'm through with that. The pay was too low, and besides, I didn't like it much.
That's no good. Your expectations can't be too high.

word.literal: to not be able to learn

sentence.idiomatic: My demands are already really small. Nowadays so many companies bully university students. The pay is low, and you can't learn anything.
You can't go with one of those companies. Don't worry, I'll help you look. Send me your resume.
Thank you, uncle! I'll send it to you right away. Oh, graduation just means unemployment. How stressful!

word.literal: in the blink of an eye
